div.h2: Tune into our monthly #UrbanaBetterTogether series that highlights the outstanding students, staff and community members who make Urbana amazing!

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-54cc306d elementor-section-height-min-height elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-items-middle elementor-invisible elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.p: Having trouble finding something on our site? There is now a Quick Links page that links you to several Urbana School District #116 pages in just one place. From registration information to transcript orders, you can use this page for quick navigation and even bookmark it for future use!

section.class: elementor-element elementor-element-4330b5fc elementor-section-full_width elementor-section-height-min-height elementor-section-height-default elementor-section-items-middle elementor-invisible elementor-section elementor-top-section

div.div: Hello USD116 family and friends! 2020 is off to a great start and there are many new memories in the making as we get closer to the end of an epic school year.

img.alt: USD116 hosts National African American Parent Involvement Day activities

h4.a: USD116 hosts National African American Parent Involvement Day activities

div.div: Looking for a way to get involved in your student’s school day? USD116 schools will be hosting several NAAPID activities for parents and community members on Feb. 10.
As National Mentoring Month continues, Urbana community members and CU One to One have all hands on deck.

img.alt: CU Schools Foundation hosts Chopped Challenge 2019 at Urbana High School

h4.a: CU Schools Foundation hosts Chopped Challenge 2019 at Urbana High School

div.div: CUSF hosted the fun-filled fourth-annual Chopped Challenge at Urbana High School on Dec. 9.

205 N. Race St.
Urbana, IL 61801
(217) 384-3600
M-Th. 7:30 a.m. – 4:30 p.m.
Fridays 7:30 a.m.-4 p.m.
